awd_titl_txt: Coronal Mass Ejections and the Rotational Bursting of       F-Coronal Dust
awd_abstract_narration: The program will investigate the rotational bursting of F-                 Coronal dust particles to high density (108 protons/cm3) Coronal               Mass Ejections in the F-Coronal region.  Rotational bursting of F-              Coronal dust make take place due to the tension caused by high spin             rate, which can be driven by four spin mechanisms.                                   Four different spin mechanisms will be investigated                        theoretically by this proposal.                                                      Repeated rotational bursting from the parent particle and its              fragments will alter the size distribution of the dust, and                     ultimately result in ejecting the resulting smaller particles from              the solar system by the action of solar radiation pressure                      overcoming the gravitational attraction of the Sun.                             #
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
